nodes.bodyText: I would suggest moving this out to a private async method for readability. Since you're already using async/await in the then handler, it seems like it would be most consistent to use it throughout rather than chaining with then and catch.
If there is no handling if value is falsy, I would suggest if (!value) return; to eliminate a layer of nesting.

We ran into this issue with some of our extensions this summer and found that it was best if we referenced JupyterLab's CSS variables for colors where possible so we would be able to support users with different JupyterLab themes.

https://jupyterlab.readthedocs.io/en/stable/developer/css.html
https://github.com/jupyterlab/jupyterlab/blob/master/packages/theme-light-extension/style/variables.css

+  --mdc-theme-primary: #1a73e8;

nodes.bodyText: Thanks! This is really helpful. I've changed to use the CSS variables defined by Jupyter.
